data.title: Lunch for friends
data.text: Best place to meet friends for lunch. Bread basket is the bomb!  Friendly staff, great menu of soups, salads, daily specials that fits every taste.

data.title: Lunch with my sis and friends
data.text: Neat little place on Square in Denton. Good menu with breakfast and lunch items available. Waitress was slow and rather scattered minded. I had buttermilk pancakes which were rather flavorless. One of our group ordered Eggs Benedict which were uneatable. A disappointing lunch except for the fellowship.

owner_response.author: Suzanne S, General Manager at The Chestnut Tree, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Claudia,
Thank you so much for your review.  I am sorry to hear about your experience.  We always try to offer our guests a great dining experience and that was obviously not the case for your group.  I would love to discuss this further with you so that I can figure out what exactly happened.  If you would like to email me at chestnuttearoom@gmail.com or call (940)591-9475, I would like to see what we can to do correct what happened.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Top Notch light food for lunch
data.text: When I lived near this little place, I ate there at least three lunches a week. Fresh and delicious food. At the time we lived near by, they had a gift shop at the front of the store and the restaurant toward the back. Not sure about now but I loved taking friends there. It was the best place for lunch ever and to pick up last minute gifts. The owners also did catering and it was top notch.

data.title: Great place, downtown, small town, lots of fun chatter going on.
data.text: Exploring for a scheduled event and found just the right lunch spot.  Like the fact that can get both breakfast or lunch after 11:00 AM.  Also plenty of vegan choices.  Friendly efficient staff, good food.  We will be bringing our event lunch to the Chestnut Tree

data.title: Really great lunch
data.text:
My wife and I spent the day today in Denton being vendors in the Arts and Cars show. I asked for a lunch suggestion and was told to try the Chestnut Tree. 

I had the very best Turkey Club sandwich to-go I probably ever had. Fresh, cooked just the way I requested and the service was wonderful. Reasonably priced too. There's a reason the place was packed today, it's that good! We shall go back next time in Denton!

data.title: Best lunch spot around
data.text:
I came here for a alumni class diner April 2015.  Great food
Came for lunch last week.  I had the  spinach salad with mushrooms.  My hubby had a turkey club sandwich.   The sandwich was enough for both of us.   Service was prompt and courteous.  We are from California where prices are higher, we didn't think it was overpriced.  We came at 1 PM somewhat after the popular lunch crowd.  
Mother and daughter at the next table were enjoying a yummy dessert.

data.title: Excellent Girls Lunch!
data.text: Food was fabulous and service was excellent! The potato salad was the best I've had at a restaurant!  Everything was fresh!

data.title: Regular venue for Lady Lunch.
data.text: Good food, but has gotten so popular that it is too noisy. Perhaps seating for fewer people would help that.

data.title: Overpriced
data.text: Sadly disappointed to see all the beautiful decor has been stripped from the restaurant leaving a barren rectangular space with a few pieces of art that looked straight from dollar general.  The ambiance is completely gone.  Had the beer bread club sandwich with a side ($1) of tomato jam.  Very good!!! The passion fruit tea ($3) tasted from a bag, not homemade.  They have always had great desserts and delicious cobbler.  Had the blackberry cobbler and it was not even warm!  Yuck!  $4 for a small bowl (no whipped cream) and it was EXACTLY like Mrs Smiths brand.... So my bill with tip was $22.  That's a lot for lunch that was so so.  I liked the baskets of mini muffins and strawberry butter for a starter but muffins were dry.  My niece ordered the Tomato Basil soup that looked delicious.  My mother ordered the sampler and didn't mention if good or not.  I think the restaurant is trying to go from more of a tea room for ladies to a unisex lunch spot.  A lot more men lunching than before.  Nice waitress.  Probably would be a while before I return.  Denton has way too many delicious restaurants down the street (Roosters, Greenhouse, Barley & Board, Hannah's) before I would spend $22 in a depressing crowded room.

data.title: Wonderful Lunch Specials
data.text: I really enjoyed the salmon special today which I had grilled instead of blackened. It was served with asparagus and mini potatoes as well as a small salad. The portions were huge. Others at the table also enjoyed their lunches. It was very noisy however so it made a lunch meeting difficult.

data.title: Love this Restaurant!
data.text: Food is prepared fresh daily. Lots to choose from for breakfast or lunch. Love their Tea Plates - you get a bit of everything, including dessert!

data.title: Fun place for lunch
data.text: Yummy choices for a quick lunch. Add flavored iced tea and sit on the sidewalk! My favorite is the chicken salad on beer bread. The broccoli salad used to be better - I usually add a soup and fruit salad to my sandwich. Muffins with flavored butter...yummy!

data.title: Breakfast or Brunch on the Denton Square
data.text: One of our favorite places to have breakfast or brunch on a Saturday morning! Great atmosphere, sometimes live music, and wonderful food. If the weather is nice, we prefer to eat out on the sidewalk, facing the Courthouse, and watch all the people going by. There's frequently something happening on the Square on the weekends, and you'll have a front-row seat while you enjoy a wonderful breakfast!!

data.title: Nice tea room
data.text: If you like quiche, this is the place. The soups, salads and daily specials are all delicious.  They have several flavors of ice tea and yummy desserts.

data.title: Great!!
data.text: Have renovated to get rid of odds and ends store at front, because the audience wants the food. Can be slower when busy, but always worth it!! And if you go when there are musicians, even better!

data.title: Great food and location
data.text: My daughter got married last year and this is where we had the rehearsal dinner. The food was great  and the accommodations for our party were great. The Chestnut tree was easy to work with and they allowed us to bring in our on bottles of wine and did not charge a corking fee.

data.title: Fun lunch on the square - good food, good atmosphere!
data.text:
Walking, people watching and looking for Saturday lunch led us to al fresco dining at The Chestnut Tree!  

Enjoyed the atmosphere of Courthouse Square while experiencing a nice lunch.

data.title: Ladies Lunch a Must
data.text: Great place to have a tea party with friends. Low key, quiet and quaint. This is a great place for the girls to get together and talk while having a light lunch.

data.title: On the Square
data.text: This charming tea room and lunch restaurant has excellent food and service.  I have eaten here several times and have always been pleased.  The servings are generous and the menu has something for everyone.  My favorite part is dessert!  The peach cobbler is yummy and I have it every time.  Of course there are other choices but I can't resist the peach.  The servers are helpful and pleasant even though they are very busy and the prices are reasonable for the quality of food. You see families, men. ladies, young and old.  Definitely worth the wait at this popular place.

data.title: Lovely Birthday Lunch!
data.text: I had a lovely birthday lunch here with colleagues! The place is right on the square and while crowded at lunch was warm and inviting. I loved the diverse menu which included lunch and breakfast options. The tomato basil soup was delicious and hit the spot on a cold day. I also had the spinach quiche which was tasty. I would definitely come here again!
